description.narrative: table, .k-table{ border-collapse:collapse; width:100%; table-layout:fixed; margin-bottom: 15px;} .k-table, .k-table td, table, table td {outline: 0;border: 1px solid #000; } .k-table td, table td { padding: 5px; } The proposed investment consists of an IFC equity co-investment of up to $15 million with Helios Investors III, LP (Helios) to support the formation of one of Africas largest Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) businesses (GBfoods Africa or the Company) through a joint venture with GBfoods S.A. The Company has acquired assets from different African companies including leading brands such as Jumbo (bouillon), Gino and Pomo (tomato paste), and Jago (milk powder and mayonnaise), as well as Bama (mayonnaise) distribution rights for Africa. This combination will result in a leading pan-African culinary products business with presence in over 30 African countries.
